messages: cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:14): [proposed] Web Fonts Working Group Charter
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:14): http://www.w3.org/2009/08/WebFonts/charter.html
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:19): cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d: Man, where did *that* come from?  I haven't seen any activity on the www-font list for some time.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:21): Looks good, though.  Just what we discussed at the planning meeting.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:22): 2009/08? Sounds obsolete already
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (22:22): That's definitely a strange date, since we didn't actually pin down any details until 09/11
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:29): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, dated space are identifiers not date.
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:30): look at the bottom of the document $Date: 2010/02/11 19:43:34 $
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:34): Wasn't there talk about finally getting rid of dates in the URLs?
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:35): Since it doesn't actually do anything except confuse people...
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:35): (same with dates in namespaces)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (22:35): looks like that Ajaxian article made reddit
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (22:35): "are we having fun yet?"
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:36): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9, what do you replace them with?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:36): Nothing
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:36): Just choose names that are unique within all names forever, rather than names that only have to be unique within all names chosen in that month
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:36): Or a generic group name, e.g. /ns/ for namespaces
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:37): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, http://w3.org/Nothing you mean ?
a19007ec26167f5b7caf77aae3640abd (22:37): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: of course
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:37): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, on a long term no name is forever
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:37): http://www.w3.org/WebFonts/charter.html etc
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:38): then in 2014, a new WebFonts WG. what do you do you had on top ? you call it WebFonts2/charter or Webfonts/charters2 ?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:38): You don't call it the WebFonts WG
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): hehe
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): ok
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): next one is WWWFonts
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): then next one is
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): WWWPolice
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:39): and then‚Ä¶ :)
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:40): btw, http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-archive/2010Feb/0002
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:44): Or you just reuse the name, and say that the group has had several incarnations
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:44): Sort of like /html works today
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:51): html didn't reuse the name
cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d (22:51): it was previously http://www.w3.org/MarkUp/ ;)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:54): A demonstration of how easy it is to find non-conflicting names that make sense :-)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (22:55): cdbe0e8aea85495cfcf22db2db988e7d: Well, the current /html manages the multi-capacity role just fine
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:59): discovers that const char* foo = "<bar baz=""/>"; doesn't do quite what he expected, even though the compiler is perfectly happy with it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:00): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: it's a feature!
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (23:01): me wonders what that does
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (23:01): it really is :)
d8cc952a670b1063df4c205ef5e920ca (23:02): 0 == strcmp("a" "b", "ab")
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:02): two string literals that are adjacent to each other get concatenated
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:02): it's useful because of macros
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:02): but it is kind of evil
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:06): It's useful for splitting long strings over multiple lines too
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:12): I'd think a line-terminating \ is a lesser evil there, or a heredoc syntax
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:13): The line-terminating \ should, ideally, be unnecessary. It's really inconvenient
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (23:14): but I think the only reason it exists is to ensure the author really meant for the string to continue, rather than an accidentally omitted quote
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:14): Makes error messages nicer :)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (23:14): But I agree it's horrible to use
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (23:16): Maybe it'd be better to have a compile-time-string-concatenation operator
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:20): which "big content companies" are involved in public-html but not whatwg?
